que: Which continent is the smallest?
expl: In terms of land area, Australia is the world's smallest continent.

que: Where are the headquarters of the United Nations located?
expl: The United Nations Head Quarters is located in Manhattan, New York since its completion in 1952.

que: Which planet is known as the red planet?
expl: Mars is often called the 'Red Planet' because it appears in the sky as an orange-red star.

que: What is the capital of Australia?
expl: Canberra is the capital of Australia.

que: Which country shares the maximum borders?
expl: China shares 14 borders which is the maximum number of borders shared by one country.

que: Which ocean is the largest ocean in the world?
expl: The Pacific Ocean is the largest and deepest of the world ocean basins. It covers approximately 63 million square miles.

que: What is the longest river in the world?
expl: The nile is the worlds longest river at 4132 miles.

que: What is the world's biggest island?
expl: Greenland is the worlds largest island. it has an area of 2,166,086 square km.

que: Which city in the world has the largest population?
expl: The largest city in the world by population is Tokyo, Japan, with a population of about 38 million.

que: Which is the most populated U.S. state?
expl: California is Americas most populous state with 38.8 million residents.

que: Which country is the largest producer of wheat?
expl: China produces around 126 million metric tons of wheat every year.

que: Which country has the longest coastline in the world?
expl: Canada is the country with the longest coastline which is 152,100 miles.

que: Where is the Dead Sea located?
expl: Dead Sea is located in the Jordan Rift Valley, bordered by Israel to the East and Jordan to the West.

que: Which country is known as the land of the rising sun?
expl: The name the land of the rising sun was chosen because the country was so close to where the sun rises.

que: Which country is the largest producer of rice?
expl: China is the world's largest rice producer with 193 million metric tons which accounts for about 35% of total world rice production.

que: Which is the smallest ocean in world?
expl: The Arctic Ocean is the smallest of the world's five ocean basins covers approximately 5.4 million square miles.

que: Kuwait is the hottest city on earth.
expl: In Kuwait temperatures like 50 to 52 degrees is not uncommon.

que: California was the first capital of America.
expl: Philadelphia was the first capital of America.

que: The first skyscraper was built in Hong Kong.
expl: The first sky scraper was the home insurance building built in Chicago in 1885.

que: Is Iceland really covered in ice.
expl: Iceland is actually really not covered in ice. It is called Iceland because the waters are full of icebergs.

que: Seattle is the capital of Washington state.
expl: Olympia is the capital of Washington state.

que: Which is the longest river in the U.S.?
expl: Missouri River stretches for 2,341 miles.

que: What is the oldest mountain range in the United States?
expl: The Black Hills, they are 1.8 billion years old. They are located mostly in South Dakota and a bit in Wyoming.

que: Which U.S. state is the Grand Canyon located in?
expl: Grand Canyon is entirely in Arizona.

que: What is the name of the tallest uninterrupted waterfall in the world?
expl: Angel Falls in Venezuela is the highest waterfall in the world. The falls are 3230 feet in height, with an uninterrupted drop of 2647 feet.

que: What is the capital of Spain?
expl: Madrid is the capital and most populous city of Spain.

que: Which river flows through Grand Canyon?
expl: Yes, it is true that the Colorado River flows through the Grand Canyon.

que: What is the smallest country in the world?
expl: Vatican City is the smallest country in the world. It is only .17 square miles in area.

que: What continent covers all four hemispheres?
expl: Africa is the only continent found in all four hemispheres.

que: Which country has more natural lakes than any other country?
expl: Canada has more natural lakes than any other country in the world. There are 561 lakes in Canada.

que: Most of the world's population lives in which hemisphere?
expl: Roughly 90% off all people live in the north.

que: What continent has the most countries?
expl: The continent of Africa has the most countries. Africa has 54 countries.

que: Where is the lowest point on Earth?
expl: The Dead Sea is the lowest point on Earth. The Dead Sea is 1,388 feet below sea level.

que: Where is the world's deepest lake?
expl: Lake Baikal is the world's deepest lake is in Siberia, Russia. It is 5,387 feet deep.

que: What is the name of the line that divides the globe into east and west?
expl: The Prime Meridian divides the globe into east and west hemispheres. The Prime Meridian is at zero degrees longitude.

que: Where is the largest volcano in the world?
expl: The largest volcano in the world is in the United States. Mauna Loa is in Hawaii and is also the most active volcano in the world.

que: Where is the largest coral reef?
expl: The largest coral reef is in Australia. It is the Great Barrier Reef.

que: What is the line called that divides the Northern and the Southern Hemispheres?
expl: The equator is the line that divides the Northern and the Southern Hemispheres.

que: How much of the surface of the world is water?
expl: About 70% of the surface of the Earth is water. The other 30% is land.

que: Which is the greenest country in the world
expl: Iceland is the greenest country in the world with an EPI score of 93.5

que: The United States state of Georgia is famous for what fruit?
expl: Georgia is known for having the best quality peach.

que: In which U.S. state would you find Mount Rushmore?
expl: Mount Rushmore is a massive sculpture carved into Mount Rushmore in South Dakota.

que: What is the smallest state in the U.S.?
expl: Rhode Island is 1,212 square miles. It is known for it's sandy shores and seaside Colonial towns.

que: Which U.S. Interstate highway is the longest?
expl: I- 90, America's longest Interstate Highway, spans from Boston, Massachusetts, to Seattle, Washington.

que: How many time zones are in Canada?
expl: Canada uses six primary time zones.

que: The Great Pyramid of Giza is located in?
expl: The great pyramid of Giza is in Egypt. It is the oldest wonder of the seven wonders of the world.

que: Which is the only US state to produce commercial coffee beans?
expl: One of only two states in the USA able to grow coffee plants commercially is Hawaii and California.

que: Death Valley is located in what U.S. state?
expl: Death Valley is located in the northern Mojave Desert of southern California.

que: Where is the the Liberty Bell located?
expl: The Liberty Bell, is an iconic symbol of American independence, located in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

que: Where is the Sears Tower located?
expl: The Willis Tower is a 110-story, 1,450-foot skyscraper in Chicago, Illinois.
